titleStmt.title: A letter to the clergy of the diocess of Norfolk and Suffolk wherein they are desired to challenge the Quakers once more to meet them in the face of the country in order to prove which of them are Christ's ministers which may be done according to the method herein laid down with very little disputation and to the great satisfaction of the auditory / by a member of the Church of England.
titleStmt.author: S. J.

titleStmt.title: A letter to the clergy of the diocess of Norfolk and Suffolk wherein they are desired to challenge the Quakers once more to meet them in the face of the country in order to prove which of them are Christ's ministers which may be done according to the method herein laid down with very little disputation and to the great satisfaction of the auditory / by a member of the Church of England.
titleStmt.author: S. J.
Field, John, 1652-1723.

notesStmt.note: Attributed by Wing to John Field, Quaker.
This item appears as Wing F864AC at reel 1615:24 and as Wing J33A (number cancelled in Wing (2nd ed.)) at reel 1464:29.
Imperfect: stained, with print show-through and loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
